bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, November 22, 1940

div1.p: Hench writes that he was glad to receive the film and photographs taken during the events at Washington and Jefferson College. He points out that his autographed photographs of Kissinger and Moran have still not been returned.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, November 22, 1940
div1.p:
I am in the last throes of finishing our Rheumatism Review. This
will take me two or three more weeks, at the end of which time I will get
at your brief article for the Red and Black, which can be reprinted or perhaps
used elsewhere. The movies came and are grand. I am delighted to have them.
I also got a set of small photographs with three additional smaller copies of
a few of them, but not of the complete set. Since I have the name of the
local photographer who handled the matter, I will write to him directly. Not
as a matter of pride but for personal reasons, I am sorry that he did not
happen to take a snapshot of your giving me the degree. They sent me one of
Doctor Clark receiving his degree. Do you happen to know whether they took
one of us? That incident is in the movie but I must confess is rather dark
and I do not believe any very clear still prints could be made from it. I
think the group photograph of us is excellent and a wonderful souvenir of a
most happy event.

Did Harriet ever receive the record of “Intermezzo” which I sent her?
I finally got a copy of the music and I am sending it to Mary. It is really
a lovely piece and not very difficult.

One thing disturbs me. I have not yet had returned to me the two
photographs, one of Kissinger and one of Moran, which your publicity depart-
ment used. These were personal photographs autographed to me, and I hope
they have not been misplaced. I mentioned the matter to Miss Hough and she
said they were probably all together in a file. I would appreciate their
return at your convenience.
div1.closer:
Always yours, Dr. Ralph C. Hutchison
President of Washington and Jefferson College
Washington, Pennsylvania
